episodeTitle: Apprentice Luffy!? The Man who Fought the Pirate King!
description: Ace, Sabo, and Luffy attempt to catch a Danpa but lose it to a tiger. While seeking revenge, they encounter a powerful bear and are rescued by Naguri, a former pirate captain who displays Conqueror's Haki. Sabo reveals Ace's connection to Gol D. Roger, causing tension between the brothers. Meanwhile, Sabo's father approaches Bluejam to retrieve his son, and Dadan learns of an incoming World Noble's visit.

events.title: The Brothers Hunt a Danpa
events.description: Ace, Sabo, and Luffy successfully catch a Danpa fish together, demonstrating their teamwork and hunting skills in the forest.
events.significance: Shows the brothers working together and establishing their daily routine of hunting for food.

events.title: Tiger Steals the Danpa
events.description: A tiger appears and steals the Danpa that the brothers had just caught, prompting them to seek revenge.
events.significance: Sets up the main conflict of the episode and demonstrates the dangers of the forest.

events.title: Bear Attack
events.description: While using fish as bait to lure the tiger, the brothers instead attract a massive and powerful bear that attacks them.
events.significance: Creates a life-threatening situation that introduces Naguri to the story.

events.title: Naguri's Debut
events.description: Naguri, a former pirate captain living in the forest, appears and rescues the three brothers from the bear by using Conqueror's Haki to intimidate it.
events.significance: Introduces an anime-original character who possesses Conqueror's Haki and has history with Gol D. Roger, making him a significant mentor figure for the brothers.

quotes.text: You youngsters shouldn't be messing with beasts you can't handle.
quotes.speaker: Naguri
quotes.context: Naguri's first words to the brothers after saving them

events.title: Naguri Uses Conqueror's Haki
events.description: Naguri demonstrates Conqueror's Haki (also known as Supreme King Haki) by simply glaring at the bear, causing it to flee in terror without any physical contact.
events.significance: This is the first appearance of Conqueror's Haki being used by an anime-original character, and provides an early example of this rare ability for the young brothers to witness.

events.title: Naguri's Past with Roger Pirates
events.description: Naguri reveals that he was once a pirate captain who fought against Gol D. Roger and the Roger Pirates, but was easily defeated. He offered his life in exchange for his crew's safety, but Roger simply walked away, showing mercy.
events.significance: Provides insight into Roger's character and establishes Naguri as a seasoned pirate with firsthand experience of the Pirate King's power and personality.

quotes.text: I once fought against the Pirate King, Gol D. Roger. My crew and I were no match for him.
quotes.speaker: Naguri
quotes.context: Naguri revealing his past to the brothers

events.title: Sabo Reveals Ace's Parentage to Luffy
events.description: Sabo tells Luffy that Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King. This is a significant revelation about Ace's heritage and the burden he carries.
events.significance: This anime-original scene reveals how Luffy learned about Ace's true parentage. In the manga, it's never explicitly shown when or how Luffy found out this information. This moment adds emotional depth to the brothers' relationship.

quotes.text: Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King.
quotes.speaker: Sabo
quotes.context: Sabo revealing Ace's true heritage to Luffy

events.title: Luffy Questions Ace About Roger
events.description: After learning about Ace's parentage, Luffy asks Ace about Gol D. Roger, wanting to know more about his father.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's innocent curiosity and sets up Ace's emotional reaction to being associated with his father.

events.title: Brothers Temporarily Break Their Bond
events.description: Ace becomes upset when questioned about Roger and declares that he doesn't want to be associated with his father. The tension causes the three brothers to declare they're breaking their bond.
events.significance: Reveals Ace's deep emotional pain regarding his parentage and hatred toward his father, showing the psychological burden of being Roger's son. The breaking of the bond creates dramatic tension.

quotes.text: Don't ever mention that man to me again!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace's angry reaction to being asked about Roger

events.title: Sabo's Father Approaches Bluejam
events.description: Outlook III, Sabo's biological father from the nobility, visits Bluejam and requests his help in retrieving Sabo and bringing him back to the noble family.
events.significance: Sets up the conflict that will lead to Sabo's forced return to noble society and the eventual tragedy involving the Gray Terminal fire.

events.title: World Noble Visit Foreshadowed
events.description: Curly Dadan discusses with Dogra and Magra the upcoming visit of a World Noble (Celestial Dragon) to the Goa Kingdom.
events.significance: Foreshadows the arrival of a Celestial Dragon, which will trigger the burning of Gray Terminal and lead to the tragic events involving Sabo.

quotes.speaker: Naguri
quotes.context: Naguri sharing his past with the brothers

themes.description: The episode explores Ace's struggle with being the son of Gol D. Roger and his desire to forge his own path and identity separate from his father's legacy.
themes.symbolism: Ace's rejection of his father represents his fight against predetermined fate and the burden of inherited sin.
culturalReferences: The concept of inherited sin and family shame in Japanese culture

themes.description: Despite learning about Ace's parentage, the bond between the brothers is tested but ultimately reinforced through their shared experiences.
themes.symbolism: The temporary breaking of the brotherhood bond symbolizes how secrets and unresolved emotions can strain even the strongest relationships.

themes.theme: Mentorship and Learning from the Past
themes.description: Naguri serves as a mentor figure who has learned from his encounters with Roger, teaching the brothers about strength and the nature of true pirate captains.
themes.symbolism: Naguri's fall from pirate captain to forest hermit represents how encounters with great figures can change one's life trajectory.

themes.description: The subplot of Sabo's father working with Bluejam highlights the corruption of nobility and the class divisions in Goa Kingdom.
themes.symbolism: The approaching World Noble visit represents the systemic oppression that will lead to the Gray Terminal fire.

mangaDifferences.difference: Naguri is an anime-original character who does not appear in the manga. His entire storyline, including his past with Roger and use of Conqueror's Haki, is exclusive to the anime.
The scene where Sabo explicitly reveals Ace's parentage to Luffy is anime-original. In the manga, it's never shown when or how Luffy learned about Ace being Roger's son.
The entire episode is primarily filler content created to expand on the brothers' childhood during the Post-War Arc flashback sequence.

trivia.fact: Naguri is the first anime-original (filler) character to be shown using Conqueror's Haki in the One Piece anime, followed later by Douglas Bullet in One Piece: Stampede.
This episode aired on May 15, 2011, during the Post-War Arc flashback sequence that showed Luffy, Ace, and Sabo's childhood together.
Episode 498 is part of the episodes that use 'Fight Together' by Namie Amuro as the opening song, which was the 14th opening and the last opening of the first half of One Piece.
From episode 279 onwards, One Piece stopped using ending themes. This episode, being in the 498 range, did not have an ending song. Ending themes weren't reinstated until episode 1071.

trivia.fact: The controversy around Naguri possessing Conqueror's Haki as a filler character has been a topic of discussion among fans, especially since popular canon characters like Sanji don't have it confirmed in the series.

sources.title: Toei Animation Giving a Filler One Piece Character Conqueror's Haki While Sanji Still Doesn't Have It May Rub Fans the Wrong Way
